questions.explanation:
7. Who's responsible for hiring at our fitness center?
(A) Mr. Gonzalez is going to get a membership. → Incorrect (unrelated to hiring responsibility)
(B) I forgot to sign in at reception. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Mr. Lin and Ms. Weiss are. → Correct (identifies who is responsible for hiring)

8. Where do you usually purchase office supplies?
(A) We put them in the hallway cabinets. → Incorrect (refers to storage, not purchase location)
(B) At the store on Maple Avenue. → Correct (specifies the purchase location)
(C) A manager's approval. → Incorrect (unrelated to location)

9. What time does Mr. Park usually leave?
(A) Around six o'clock in the evening. → Correct (specifies the departure time)
(B) He left everything we need. → Incorrect (unrelated to usual leaving time)
(C) We've had many interns over the years. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

10. Do you want to present your research to the marketing team?
(A) That's what I've heard as well. → Incorrect (unrelated to presenting)
(B) If we can find the time for it. → Correct (addresses the possibility of presenting)
(C) Yes, I received the gift. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

11. Our company picnic is on Friday, isn't it?
(A) Those times are both booked. → Incorrect (unrelated to confirming the date)
(B) Only if you can find them easily. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Right—in two days. → Correct (confirms the picnic is on Friday)

12. Isn't the bus supposed to stop here?
(A) Yes, according to the schedule. → Correct (confirms the bus stop location)
(B) I'm on my way now. → Incorrect (unrelated to the bus stop)
(C) It listed several potential clients. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

13. We should fill this order quickly, shouldn't we?
(A) No, I haven't yet. → Incorrect (unrelated to urgency)
(B) Yes, it's for an important client. → Correct (agrees and provides a reason)
(C) Try using this key. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the order)

14. How do you like your new job?
(A) I can work from home quite often. → Correct (describes a positive aspect of the job)
(B) A career in electrical engineering. → Incorrect (unrelated to job experience)
(C) My sister helped me apply. → Incorrect (irrelevant to liking the job)

15. Let's go to the cafeteria for lunch today.
(A) There should be one in the filing cabinet. → Incorrect (unrelated to lunch plans)
(B) Which local restaurant do you prefer? → Incorrect (suggests an alternative, not cafeteria)
(C) I don't think I can take a break. → Correct (responds to the lunch invitation)

16. When will we hire the new interns?
(A) Mr. Wyeth is handling that. → Correct (points to the person managing the hiring)
(B) With more time to spare than usual. → Incorrect (unrelated to timing)
(C) The highest available salary. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

17. How often should I mail these statements?
(A) Yes, you can buy one online. → Incorrect (unrelated to mailing frequency)
(B) The post office on Grant Street. → Incorrect (refers to location, not frequency)
(C) We send them out once a month. → Correct (specifies the mailing frequency)

18. Why did you put that food in the freezer?
(A) It's not working well currently. → Incorrect (refers to freezer condition, not reason)
(B) I meant to put it in the refrigerator. → Correct (explains the action as a mistake)
(C) Let's start making dinner soon. → Incorrect (unrelated to the question)

19. Could you print the agenda for the meeting?
(A) It's already on your desk. → Correct (confirms the agenda is printed)
(B) No, the other printer. → Incorrect (unrelated to the request)
(C) Was that a client? → Incorrect (irrelevant to the agenda)

20. How far are you from the clinic?
(A) I'm close enough to walk. → Correct (specifies distance to the clinic)
(B) I need to see the doctor. → Incorrect (unrelated to distance)
(C) It's a well-known clinic. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

21. Didn't you get a printout of the company newsletter from Emiko?
(A) She started working here three years ago. → Incorrect (unrelated to the newsletter)
(B) I was out of town last week. → Incorrect (explains absence, not newsletter receipt)
(C) Yes, I do like to write. → Incorrect (unrelated to receiving the printout)
Note: No correct answer provided; correct answer should be, e.g., 'Yes, I got it.'

22. When do you need to renew your passport?
(A) Be careful not to lose your tickets. → Incorrect (unrelated to passport renewal)
(B) A brand-new type of microchip. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Soon, because it's about to expire. → Correct (specifies renewal timing)

23. Who can help me find replacement parts for my computer?
(A) Here are all the latest statements. → Incorrect (unrelated to computer parts)
(B) I can help you look through the inventory. → Correct (offers help with finding parts)
(C) Put these on that shelf. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

24. I can't make it to the company dinner tonight.
(A) Managers expect everyone to be there. → Correct (notes expectation, this answer)
(B) A buffet-style restaurant. → Incorrect (unrelated to the absence)
(C) A meeting once a week. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the dinner)

25. Do you work in this neighborhood?
(A) Yes, I'd like to. → Incorrect (expresses desire, not current work location)
(B) No, my office isn't nearby. → Correct (confirms work location)
(C) There aren't any of those here. → Incorrect (unrelated to the question)

26. It's time for our quarterly earnings report, isn't it?
(A) Was there an e-mail reminder about it? → Correct (seeks confirmation of the report timing)
(B) To pay for a new advertising campaign. → Incorrect (unrelated to the report timing)
(C) No, a different pair of earrings. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

27. What did you do with the guest list that I sent you?
(A) After everyone received it. → Incorrect (unrelated to the action taken)
(B) I passed it along to everyone who needed it. → Correct (describes what was done with the list)
(C) We're supposed to leave soon. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

28. Did you see the announcement about Emily's promotion?
(A) All the technology's been upgraded. → Incorrect (unrelated to the announcement)
(B) Perhaps a good career counselor. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I've been busy all morning. → Correct (explains do not know, this answer)

29. Let's try our best to finish the project on time.
(A) All except the first one. → Incorrect (unrelated to project completion)
(B) We may need a few more days. → Correct (responds to the project timeline)
(C) I think over time it will. → Incorrect (vague and unrelated)

30. Where's the store manager?
(A) A recent hiring decision. → Incorrect (unrelated to manager's location)
(B) I enjoy shopping at that store. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) She went out for lunch. → Correct (specifies the manager's location)

31. The software you're using isn't very reliable.
(A) These chairs aren't very comfortable. → Incorrect (unrelated to software reliability)
(B) I've been using it for years with no problems. → Correct (counters the reliability concern)
(C) I saw that computer at the store. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the software)
